bibl.title: Voucher No. 3, 1798 Sep. 5 [to] William Mizell
bibl.note: The following document is a voucher dated September 5, 1798, for William Mizell. Mizell served as interpreter for the Chickasaw Bluffs and was to be paid 369 dollars and 02 cents for his services.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p:
To William Mizell — — — — — — — Dr.
dollr.—cents
To his services as Interpreter for the Post at the Chickasaw Bluffs, and that nation— from the 1st of May to the 31st of August —98— at one dollar pr. day ―123―"
To subsistence for same period at 2 ration pr. day — 17.Cents —41 ―02
To one Bay horse furnished for the use of the Qmaster Department & for the purpose of Express riding ―55 ―"
To Six Beefs— for the use of the Chickasaw Indians— and for the use of the sick in the Hospital of the Detach. of troops descending the Mississippi under the orders of Genl. Wilkinson —150 —"
Total —369 —02 — The Quartermaster will discharge the above Account —

Received at the Chickasaw Bluffs 5th. September 1798 — Of John Wilkins Junr. Quartermaster General — Three hundred & sixty nine dollars 02 Cents in full —of the account above Stated — Signed duplicates —
The Qr. Mr. will examine the written amt., discharge the same & plan to the proper Hand
